alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Pembina; Steele; Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 11 at 2:52PM CST until March 12 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Blowing snow could reduce visibility to near whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Pembina; Steele; Traill
